5.heading: Hérody, Dominique.
5.title: "Alack Sinner, Rencontres et Souvenirs"
5.author: Dominique Hérody
5.appears_in: p. 20-29 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: Begins: "Relier toutes les données biographiques relatives à un personnage imaginaire peut sembler une entreprise paradoxale. Sauf peut-être quand il s'agit d'Alack Sinner, dont la vie nous a été contée par Carlos Sampayo et José Muñoz tout au long de quelque 600 page, échelonnées sur 18 ans. Derrière l'histoire de sa vie se laisse aussi appréhender, en filigrane, l'évolution du personnage dans l'esprit de ses créateurs."

English summary (from p. 138): "Alack Sinner, Memories and Encounters: José Muñoz and Carlos Sampayo, two Argentinians, have been in close contact with the character Alack Sinner for 18 years and some 600 pages. Dominique Hérody has assembled all the biographical details of this very real fictional character. Whilst piecing together the story of his life, he points out the manner in which his creators' relationship with him evolves over the years."

6.heading: Hérody, Dominique.
6.title: "Autour de Saturne"
6.author: Dominique Hérody
6.appears_in: p. 141 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 5 (Jan. 2000).
notes: Review of Pourquoi Je Déteste Saturne (=Why I Hate Saturn) (Kyle Baker).

7.heading: Hérody, Dominique.
7.title: "Blutch : Thème et Variations"
7.author: Dominique Hérody
7.appears_in: p. 118-119 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 2 (Jan. 1997).
notes: Essay on the work of Blutch, beginning with his Péplum and its edited pre-publicaton in (À Suivre) in 1996.

8.heading: Hérody, Dominique.
8.title: "En Atelier"
8.author: Dominique Hérody
8.appears_in: p. 76-86 in 9e Art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 8 (Jan. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Trondheim, David B., Boilet, Blain, Guibert, Sfar. Ces têtes d'affiche de la jeune bande dessinée n'ont pas seulement en commun un formidable talent. Ils ont, à un moment ou un autre, travaillé en atelier. L'atelier Nawak, et plus tard l'ataelier des Vosges, ont été le creuset d'une génération exceptionnelle, le lieu de rencontres déterminantes et de collaborations fécondes. Dominique Hérody, qui participa lui-même à cette aventure collective, a mené l'enquête pour en retracer les péripéties multiplies. Cette plongée dans les coulisses de la création relève de la petite histoire mais jette un éclairage déterminant et inédit sur un pan entier de la bande dessinée contemporaine."

English summary (from p. 151): "At the Workshop. Trondheim, David B., Boilet, Blain, Guibert, Sfar, de Crécy, Satrapi. All these young stars of comic art have at some point in their careers, taken part in the life of the 'Atelier Nawak' founded in 1991 (which later became 'l'Atelier des Vosges' when it changed location). A series of interviews with the participants in this collective adventure have permitted Dominique Hérody to retrace the history of this workshop, which has played an essential part in the recent evolution of creative draughtsmanship in France."

notes: Based on the awards at the Salon international de la bande dessinée d'Angoulême.

15.heading: Hérody, Dominique.
15.title: "Récits Croisés"
15.author: José Muñoz, Carlos Sampayo ; propos recueillis à Angoulême en janvier 1996 par Dominique Hérody ; traduits et adaptés avec la complicité de Mercédès Gonzalez et Jean-Pierre Mercier
15.appears_in: p. 30-37 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: English summary (from p. 138): "Crossed Paths. In a double interview, Muñoz and Sampayo evoke the following subjects: their childhood in Argentina, the circumstances of their exile in Europe, meeting each other, working together, the aesthetics of black and white, the importance of the passage of time in their scripts, their attitude to New York and to music, and finally, the status of comics."

117.author: [No author]
117.library has: no. 1-2, 4-5, 8-9, 15 (1964-1966) 1. War comics. I. Charlton Comics Group. k. War Heroes. k. Heroes. Call no.
notes: Published no. 1 (Jan. 1964) - no. 18 (Mar. 1967), cf. Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide.

118.heading: Heroes.
118.title: "Marvel's Amazing-Man : Celebrating Gil Kane, Our Great Cover Artist, and the Heroic Ideal" p. 1 in Comic Book Artist, no. 2
118.author: [No author]
notes: Includes Gil Kane's discussion of his idea of a hero, using Bill Everett's Amazing-Man and Steve Ditko's Spider-Man as his prime examples.

119.heading: Heroes.
119.title: "Maybe We Can Save Someone and Be Heroes"
119.author: Jim Mooney
119.appears_in: p. 16-17 in Treasure Chest of Fun & Fact, v. 4, no. 6 (Nov. 16, 1948).
notes: Summary: Perky and Booby get to a fire before the fire department.

121.heading: Heroes.
121.title: More Hard-Traveling Heroes
121.author: Dennis O'Neil, writer ; Neal Adams, penciller ; Frank Giacoia, Dan Adkins, and Dick Giordano, inkers.
notes: (Green Lantern Green Arrow, the Collection ; v. 2)

122.heading: Heroes.
122.title: "My Heroes Have Always Been Super"
122.author: Sal Amendola
122.appears_in: p. 90-97 in Streetwise : Autobiographical Stories (Raleigh, NC : TwoMorrows Publishing, 2000).

123.heading: Heroes.
123.title: Navy War Heroes.
123.author: [No author]
notes: Published no. 1 (Jan. 1964) - no. 7 (Mar./Apr. 1965), cf. Overstreet comic book price guide.

125.heading: Heroes.
125.title: "Nisei Hero : Ben Kuroki" 5 p. in True Comics, no. 49
125.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Japanese American Ben Kuroki from Hershey, Nebraska, born in 1918, was a U.S. Air Corpsman in World War II, who received three Distinguished Flying Crosses for action in Europe and the Pacific.
